title: Chatbot
sentence: In 1950, Alan Turing's famous article "Computing Machinery and Intelligence" was published, which proposed what is now called the Turing test as a criterion of intelligence.

title: Chatbot
sentence: This criterion depends on the ability of a computer program to impersonate a human in a real-time written conversation with a human judge, sufficiently well that the judge is unable to distinguish reliably—on the basis of the conversational content alone—between the program and a real human.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The notoriety of Turing's proposed test stimulated great interest in Joseph Weizenbaum's program ELIZA, published in 1966, which seemed to be able to fool users into believing that they were conversing with a real human.

title: Chatbot
sentence: However Weizenbaum himself did not claim that ELIZA was genuinely intelligent, and the introduction to his paper presented it more as a debunking exercise:

title: Chatbot
sentence: [In] artificial intelligence ... machines are made to behave in wondrous ways, often sufficient to dazzle even the most experienced observer.

title: Chatbot
sentence: But once a particular program is unmasked, once its inner workings are explained ... its magic crumbles away; it stands revealed as a mere collection of procedures ...

title: Chatbot
sentence: The observer says to himself "I could have written that".

title: Chatbot
sentence: With that thought he moves the program in question from the shelf marked "intelligent", to that reserved for curios ...

title: Chatbot
sentence: The object of this paper is to cause just such a re-evaluation of the program about to be "explained".

title: Chatbot
sentence: Few programs ever needed it more.

title: Chatbot
sentence: ELIZA's key method of operation (copied by chatbot designers ever since) involves the recognition of clue words or phrases in the input, and the output of corresponding pre-prepared or pre-programmed responses that can move the conversation forward in an apparently meaningful way (e.g. by responding to any input that contains the word 'MOTHER' with 'TELL ME MORE ABOUT YOUR FAMILY').

title: Chatbot
sentence: Thus an illusion of understanding is generated, even though the processing involved has been merely superficial.

title: Chatbot
sentence: ELIZA showed that such an illusion is surprisingly easy to generate, because human judges are so ready to give the benefit of the doubt when conversational responses are capable of being interpreted as "intelligent".

title: Chatbot
sentence: Interface designers have come to appreciate that humans' readiness to interpret computer output as genuinely conversational—even when it is actually based on rather simple pattern-matching—can be exploited for useful purposes.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Most people prefer to engage with programs that are human-like, and this gives chatbot-style techniques a potentially useful role in interactive systems that need to elicit information from users, as long as that information is relatively straightforward and falls into predictable categories.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Thus, for example, online help systems can usefully employ chatbot techniques to identify the area of help that users require, potentially providing a "friendlier" interface than a more formal search or menu system.

title: Chatbot
sentence: This sort of usage holds the prospect of moving chatbot technology from Weizenbaum's "shelf ... reserved for curios" to that marked "genuinely useful computational methods".

title: Chatbot
sentence: The classic historic early chatbots are ELIZA (1966) and PARRY (1972).

title: Chatbot
sentence: More recent notable programs include A.L.I.C.E., Jabberwacky and D.U.D.E

title: Chatbot
sentence: (Agence Nationale de la Recherche and CNRS 2006).

title: Chatbot
sentence: While ELIZA and PARRY were used exclusively to simulate typed conversation, many chatbots now include functional features such as games and web searching abilities.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In 1984, a book called The Policeman's Beard is Half Constructed was published, allegedly written by the chatbot Racter (though the program as released would not have been capable of doing so).One pertinent field of AI research is natural language processing.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Usually, weak AI fields employ specialized software or programming languages created specifically for the narrow function required.

title: Chatbot
sentence: For example, A.L.I.C.E. uses a markup language called AIML, which is specific to its function as a conversational agent, and has since been adopted by various other developers of, so called, Alicebots.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Nevertheless, A.L.I.C.E. is still purely based on pattern matching techniques without any reasoning capabilities, the same technique ELIZA was using back in 1966.

title: Chatbot
sentence: This is not strong AI, which would require sapience and logical reasoning abilities.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Jabberwacky learns new responses and context based on real-time user interactions, rather than being driven from a static database.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Some more recent chatbots also combine real-time learning with evolutionary algorithms that optimise their ability to communicate based on each conversation held.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Still, there is currently no general purpose conversational artificial intelligence, and some software developers focus on the practical aspect, information retrieval.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbot competitions focus on the Turing test or more specific goals.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Two such annual contests are the Loebner Prize and The Chatterbox Challenge (the latter has been offline since 2015, however materials can still be found from web archives).DBpedia created a chatbot during the GSoC of 2017. and can communicate through Facebook Messenger.

title: Chatbot
sentence: DBpedia started in 2007 and allows to extract structured content from the Wikipedia dataset, along with many other datasets.

title: Chatbot
sentence: DBpedia is currently one of the biggest representatives of Linked Open Data (LOD).

title: Chatbot
sentence: Many companies' chatbots run on messaging apps or simply via SMS.

title: Chatbot
sentence: They are used for B2C customer service, sales and marketing.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In 2016, Facebook Messenger allowed developers to place chatbots on their platform.

title: Chatbot
sentence: There were 30,000 bots created for Messenger in the first six months, rising to 100,000 by September 2017.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Since September 2017, this has also been as part of a pilot program on WhatsApp.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Airlines KLM and Aeroméxico both announced their participation in the testing; both airlines had previously launched customer services on the Facebook Messenger platform.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The bots usually appear as one of the user's contacts, but can sometimes act as participants in a group chat.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Many banks, insurers, media companies, e-commerce companies, airlines, hotel chains, retailers, health care providers, government entities and restaurant chains have used chatbots to answer simple questions, increase customer engagement, for promotion, and to offer additional ways to order from them.

title: Chatbot
sentence: A 2017 study showed 4% of companies used chatbots.

title: Chatbot
sentence: According to a 2016 study, 80% of businesses said they intended to have one by 2020.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Other companies explore ways they can use chatbots internally, for example for Customer Support, Human Resources, or even in Internet-of-Things (IoT) projects.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Overstock.com, for one, has reportedly launched a chatbot named Mila to automate certain simple yet time-consuming processes when requesting for a sick leave.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Other large companies such as Lloyds Banking Group, Royal Bank of Scotland, Renault and Citroën are now using automated online assistants instead of call centres with humans to provide a first point of contact.

title: Chatbot
sentence: A SaaS chatbot business ecosystem has been steadily growing since the F8 Conference when Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg unveiled that Messenger would allow chatbots into the app.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In large companies, like in hospitals and aviation organizations, IT architects are designing reference architectures for Intelligent Chatbots that are used to unlock and share knowledge and experience in the organization more efficiently, and reduce the errors in answers from expert service desks significantly.

title: Chatbot
sentence: These Intelligent Chatbots make use of all kinds of artificial intelligence like image moderation and natural language understanding (NLU), natural language generation (NLG), machine learning and deep learning.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Nowadays a high majority of high-tech banking organizations are looking for integration of automated AI-based solutions such as chatbots in their customer service in order to provide faster and cheaper assistance to their clients becoming increasingly technodexterous.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In particularly, chatbots can efficiently conduct a dialogue, usually substituting other communication tools such as email, phone, or SMS.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In banking area their major application is related to quick customer service answering common requests, and transactional support.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Several studies accomplished by analytics agencies such as Juniper or Gartner  report significant reduction of cost of customer services, leading to billions of dollars of economy in the next 10 years.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Gartner predicts an integration by 2020 of chatbots in at least 85% of all client's applications to customer service.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Juniper's study announces an impressive amount of $8 billion retained annually by 2022 due to the use of chatbots.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Since 2016 when Facebook allows businesses to deliver automated customer support, e-commerce guidance, content and interactive experiences through chatbots, a large variety of chatbots for Facebook Messenger platform were developed.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In 2016, Russia-based Tochka Bank launched the world's first Facebook bot for a range of financial services, in particularly including a possibility of making payments.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In July 2016, Barclays Africa also launched a Facebook chatbot, making it the first bank to do so in Africa.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The France's third largest bank by total assets

title: Chatbot
sentence: Société Générale launched their chatbot called SoBot in March 2018.

title: Chatbot
sentence: While the 80% of users of the SoBot express their satisfaction after having tested it, il will never replace the expertise provided by a human advisor according to SG deputy director Bertrand Cozzarolo.

title: Chatbot
sentence:
There are several potential advantages of using chatbots in interaction with customer in banking:
Cost reduction.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbots eliminate the obligation of any human presence during online interaction and are so long seen as a huge advantage by companies operating with multiple repetitive queries at once as long as they don't require any decision-making procedure.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Human touch.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbots, providing an interface similar to human-to-human interaction, are more intuitive and so less difficult to use than a standard banking mobile application.

title: Chatbot
sentence: They do not require any additional software installation and are more adaptive as able to be personalized during the exploitation by the means of machine learning.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbots are instant and so much faster that phone calls, shown to be considered as tedious in some studies.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Then they satisfy both speed and personalization requirement while interacting with a bank.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Financial advice.

title: Chatbot
sentence: State-of-the-art banking assistants can, by accessing personal customer's data such as consumer behavior or history of purchases, provide useful information on client's account and use it to develop AI-Based recommendations for better adapted money management.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Attracting new clients.

title: Chatbot
sentence: A chatbot greeting a bank's website guest can provide some useful and relevant information, helping to exploit the offered products and services in a personalized manner helps to attract the potential client and the he is more likely to end by creation of a new account.

title: Chatbot
sentence: 24/7 digital support.

title: Chatbot
sentence: An instant and always accessible assistant is assumed by the more and more digital consumer of the new era.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Unlike humans, chatbots once developed and installed don't have a limited workdays, holidays or weekends and are ready to attend queries at any hour of the day.

title: Chatbot
sentence: It helps to the customer to avoid waiting of a company's agent to be available.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Thus, the customer doesn't have to wait for the company executive to help them.

title: Chatbot
sentence: This also lets companies keep an eye on the traffic during the non-working hours and reach out to them later.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbots are also appearing in the healthcare industry.

title: Chatbot
sentence: A study suggested that physicians in the United States believed that chatbots would be most beneficial for scheduling doctor appointments, locating health clinics, or providing medication information.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Certain patient groups are still reluctant to use chatbots.

title: Chatbot
sentence: A mixed-methods study showed that people are still hesitant to use chatbots for their healthcare due to poor understanding of the technological complexity, the lack of empathy and concerns about cyber-security.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The analysis showed that while 6% had heard of a health chatbot and 3% had experience of using it, 67% perceived themselves as likely to use one within 12 months.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The majority of participants would use a health chatbot for seeking general health information (78%), booking a medical appointment (78%) and looking for local health services (80%).

title: Chatbot
sentence: However, a health chatbot was perceived as less suitable for seeking results of medical tests and seeking specialist advice such as sexual health.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The analysis of attitudinal variables showed that most participants reported their preference for discussing their health with doctors (73%) and having access to reliable and accurate health information (93%).

title: Chatbot
sentence: While 80% were curious about new technologies that could improve their health, 66% reported only seeking a doctor when experiencing a health problem and 65% thought that a chatbot was a good idea.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Interestingly, 30% reported dislike about talking to computers, 41% felt it would be strange to discuss health matters with a chatbot and about half were unsure if they could trust the advice given by a chatbot.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Therefore, perceived trustworthiness, individual attitudes towards bots and dislike for talking to computers are the main barriers to health chatbots.

title: Chatbot
sentence: In New Zealand, the chatbot SAM -short for Semantic Analysis Machine-

title: Chatbot
sentence: (made by Nick Gerritsen of Touchtech) has been developed.

title: Chatbot
sentence: It is designed to share its political thoughts, for example on topics such as climate change, healthcare and education, etc.

title: Chatbot
sentence: It talks to people through Facebook Messenger.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbots have also been incorporated into devices not primarily meant for computing such as toys.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Hello Barbie is an Internet-connected version of the doll that uses a chatbot provided by the company ToyTalk, which previously used the chatbot for a range of smartphone-based characters for children.

title: Chatbot
sentence: These characters' behaviors are constrained by a set of rules that in effect emulate a particular character and produce a storyline.

title: Chatbot
sentence: IBM's Watson computer has been used as the basis for chatbot-based educational toys for companies such as CogniToys intended to interact with children for educational purposes.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The process of building, testing and deploying chatbots can be done on cloud-based chatbot development platforms offered by cloud Platform as a Service (PaaS) providers such as Oracle Cloud Platform  SnatchBot and IBM Watson.

title: Chatbot
sentence: These cloud platforms provide Natural Language Processing, Artificial Intelligence and Mobile Backend as a Service for chatbot development.

title: Chatbot
sentence: API

title: Chatbot
sentence: Some Companies like Microsoft Azure and AARC are currently providing their Bot Engines through which chatbot Platforms or Software can be developed.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Malicious chatbots are frequently used to fill chat rooms with spam and advertisements, by mimicking human behavior and conversations or to entice people into revealing personal information, such as bank account numbers.

title: Chatbot
sentence: They are commonly found on Yahoo!

title: Chatbot
sentence: Messenger, Windows Live Messenger, AOL Instant Messenger and other instant messaging protocols.

title: Chatbot
sentence: There has also been a published report of a chatbot used in a fake personal ad on a dating service's website.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Tay, an AI chatbot that learns from previous interaction, caused major controversy due to it being targeted by internet trolls on Twitter.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The bot was exploited, and after 16 hours began to send extremely offensive Tweets to users.

title: Chatbot
sentence: This suggests that although the bot learnt effectively from experience, adequate protection was not put in place to prevent misuse.

title: Chatbot
sentence: If a text-sending algorithm can pass itself off as a human instead of a chatbot, its message would be more credible.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Therefore, human-seeming chatbots with well-crafted online identities could start scattering fake news that seem plausible, for instance making false claims during a presidential election.

title: Chatbot
sentence: With enough chatbots, it might be even possible to achieve artificial social proof.

title: Chatbot
sentence: The creation and implementation of chatbots is still a developing area, heavily related to artificial intelligence and machine learning, so the provided solutions, while possessing obvious advantages, have some important limitations in terms of functionalities and use cases.

title: Chatbot
sentence: However this is changing over time.

title: Chatbot
sentence:
The most common ones are listed below:
As the database, used for output generation, is fixed and limited, chatbots can fail while dealing with an unsaved query.

title: Chatbot
sentence:
A chatbot's efficiency highly depends on language processing and is limited because of irregularities, such as accents and mistakes that can create an important barrier for international and multi-cultural organisations
Chatbots are unable to deal with multiple questions at the same time and so conversation opportunities are limited.

title: Chatbot
sentence: As it happens usually with technology-led changes in existing services, some consumers, more often than not from the old generation, are uncomfortable with chatbots due to their limited understanding, making it obvious that their requests are being dealt machines.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Chatbots are increasingly present in businesses and often are used to automate tasks that do not require skill-based talents.

title: Chatbot
sentence: With customer service taking place via messaging apps as well as phone calls, there are growing numbers of use-cases where chatbot deployment gives organisations a clear return on investment.

title: Chatbot
sentence: Call centre workers may be particularly at risk from AI-driven chatbots.

title: Chatbot
sentence: A study by Forrester (June 2017) predicts that 25% of today's jobs will most likely be impacted by AI technologies by 2019.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It is sometimes desirable to identify when a Twitter account is controlled by a bot.

title: Twitterbot
sentence:
In a 2012 paper, Chu et al. propose the following criteria that indicate that an account may be a bot (they were designing an automated system):

"Periodic and regular timing" of tweets;
Whether the tweet content contains known spam; and
The ratio of tweets from mobile versus desktop, as compared to an average human Twitter user.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Research shows that humans can view Twitter bots as a credible source of information.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: There are many different types of Twitter bots and their purposes vary from one to another.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Some bots may tweet helpful material such as @EarthquakesSF (description below).

title: Twitterbot
sentence: In 2009, Twitter bots were estimated to create approximately 24% of tweets that on Twitter.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Here are examples of some of the Twitter bots and how they interact with users on Twitter.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @Betelgeuse_3 sends at-replies in response to tweets that include the phrase, "Beetlejuice, beetlejuice, beetlejuice".

title: Twitterbot
sentence: The tweets are sent in the voice of the lead character from the Beetlejuice film.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @CongressEdits and @parliamentedits posts whenever someone makes edits to Wikipedia from the US Congress and UK Parliament IP addresses, respectively.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @DBZNappa replied with "WHAT!?

title: Twitterbot
sentence: NINE THOUSAND?

title: Twitterbot
sentence: " to anyone on Twitter that used the internet meme phrase "over 9000".

title: Twitterbot
sentence: The account began in 2011, and was eventually suspended in 2015, most likely a victim of its own success.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @DearAssistant sends auto-reply tweets responding to complex queries in simple English by utilizing Wolfram Alpha.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @DeepDrumpf is a recurrent neural network, created at MIT, that releases tweets imitating Donald Trump's speech patterns.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It received its namesake from the term 'Donald Drumpf', popularized in the segment 'Donald Trump' from the show Last Week Tonight with John Oliver.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @DroptheIBot tweets the message, "People aren't illegal.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Try saying 'undocumented immigrant' or 'unauthorized immigrant' instead" to Twitter users who have sent a tweet containing the phrase "illegal immigrant".

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It was created by American Fusion.net journalists Jorge Rivas and Patrick Hogan.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @everyword has tweeted every word of the English language.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It started in 2007 and tweeted every thirty minutes until 2014.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @factbot1 was created by Eric Drass to illustrate what he believed to be a prevalent problem: that of people on the internet believing unsupported facts which accompany pictures.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @fuckeveryword

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @Horse_ebooks was a bot that gained a following among people who found its tweets poetic.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It has inspired various _ebooks-suffixed Twitter bots which use Markov text generators (or similar techniques) to create new tweets by mashing up the tweets of their owner.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It went inactive following a brief promotion for Bear Stearns Bravo.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @infinite_scream tweets and auto-replies a 2-39 character scream.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: At least partially inspired by Edvard Munch's The Scream, it attracted attention from those distressed by the Presidency of Donald Trump and bad news.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @MetaphorMagnet is an AI bot that generates metaphorical insights using its knowledge-base of stereotypical properties and norms.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: A companion bot @MetaphorMirror pairs these metaphors to news tweets.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Another companion bot @BestOfBotWorlds uses metaphor to generate faux-religious insights.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @Pentametron finds tweets incidentally written in iambic pentameter using the CMU Pronouncing Dictionary, pairs them into couplets using a rhyming dictionary, and retweets them as couplets into followers' feeds.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @RedScareBot tweets in the persona of Joseph McCarthy in response to Twitter posts mentioning "socialist", "communist", or "communism".

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @tinycarebot promotes simple self care actions to its followers, such as remembering to look up from your screens, taking a break to go outside, and drink more water.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: It will also send a self care suggestion if you tweet directly at it.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: There are also families of related Twitter bots.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: For example, @LessicoFeed, @SpracheFeed, @SwedishFeed, @TraductionFeed, @VocabularioFeed, @WelshFeed each tweet an English word along with a translation every hour into Italian, German, Swedish, French, Spanish, and Welsh, respectively.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: The translations are crowdsourced by volunteers and subscribers.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Detecting non-human Twitter users has been of interest to academics.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Indiana University has developed a free service called Botometer (formerly BotOrNot), which scores Twitter handles based on their likelihood of being a Twitterbot.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: One significant academic study estimated that up to 15% of Twitter users were automated bot accounts.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: The prevalence of Twitter bots coupled with the ability of some bots to give seemingly human responses has enabled these non-human accounts to garner widespread influence.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: A subset of Twitter bots programmed to complete social tasks played an important role in the United States 2016 Presidential Election.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Researchers estimated that pro-Trump bots generated four tweets for every pro-Clinton automated account and out-tweeted pro-Clinton bots 7:1 on relevant hashtags during the final debate.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Deceiving Twitter bots fooled candidates and campaign staffers into retweeting misappropriated quotes and accounts affiliated with incendiary ideals.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Concerns about political Twitter bots include the promulgation of malicious content, increased polarization, and the spreading of fake news.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Many non-malicious bots are popular for their entertainment value.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: However, as technology and the creativity of bot-makers improves, so does the potential for Twitter bots that fill social needs.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: @tinycarebot is a Twitterbot that encourages followers to practice self care, and brands are increasingly using automated Twitter bots to engage with customers in interactive ways.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: One anti-bullying organization has created @TheNiceBot, which attempts to combat the prevalence of mean tweets by automatically tweeting kind messages.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: The majority of Twitter accounts following public figures and brands are often fake or inactive, making the number of Twitter followers a celebrity a difficult metric for gauging popularity.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: While this cannot always be helped, some public figures who have gained or lost huge quantities of followers in short periods of time have been accused of discreetly paying for Twitter followers.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: For example, the Twitter accounts of Sean Combs, Rep Jared Polis (D-Colo), PepsiCo, Mercedes-Benz, and 50 Cent have come under scrutiny for possibly engaging in the buying and selling of Twitter followers, which is estimated to be between a $40 million and $360 million business annually.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: Account sellers may charge a premium for more realistic accounts that have Twitter profile pictures and bios and retweet the accounts they follow.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: In addition to an ego boost, public figures may gain  more lucrative endorsement contracts from inflated Twitter metrics.

title: Twitterbot
sentence: For brands, however, the translation of online buzz and social media followers into sales has recently come under question after The Coca-Cola Company disclosed that a corporate study revealed that social media buzz does not create a spike in short term sales.

title: Social bot
sentence:
Lutz Finger identifies 5 immediate uses for social bots:
foster fame: having an arbitrary number of (unrevealed) bots as (fake) followers can help simulate real success
spamming: having advertising bots in online chats is similar to email spam, but a lot more direct
mischief:

title: Social bot
sentence:
e.g. signing up an opponent with a lot of fake identities and spam the account or help others discover it to discreditize the opponent
bias public opinion: influence trends by countless messages of similar content with different phrasings
limit free speech: important messages can be pushed out of sight by a deluge of automated bot messagesThe effects of all points can be likened to and support methods of traditional psychological warfare.

title: Social bot
sentence: The first generation of bots could sometimes be distinguished from real users by their often superhuman capacities to post messages around the clock (and at massive rates).

title: Social bot
sentence: Later developments have succeeded in imprinting more "human" activity and behavioral patterns in the agent.

title: Social bot
sentence:
To unambiguously detect social bots as what they are, a variety of criteria must be applied together using pattern detection techniques, some of which are:
cartoon figures as user pictures
sometimes also random real user pictures are captured (identity fraud)
reposting rate
temporal patterns
sentiment expression
followers-to-friends ratio
length of user names
variability in (re)posted messagesBotometer (formerly BotOrNot) is a public Web service that checks the activity of a Twitter account and gives it a score based on how likely the account is to be a bot.

title: Social bot
sentence: The system leverages over a thousand features.

title: Social bot
sentence: An active method that worked well in detecting early spam bots was to set up honeypot accounts where obvious nonsensical content was posted and then dumbly reposted (retweeted) by bots.

title: Social bot
sentence: However, recent studies show that bots evolve quickly and detection methods have to be updated constantly, because otherwise they may get useless after few years.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Some bots communicate with other users of Internet-based services, via instant messaging (IM), Internet Relay Chat (IRC), or another web interface such as Facebook Bots and Twitterbots.

title: Internet bot
sentence: These chatterbots may allow people to ask questions in plain English and then formulate a proper response.

title: Internet bot
sentence: These bots can often handle many tasks, including reporting weather, zip-code information, sports scores, converting currency or other units, etc.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Others are used for entertainment, such as SmarterChild on AOL Instant Messenger and MSN Messenger.

title: Internet bot
sentence: An additional role of IRC bots may be to lurk in the background of a conversation channel, commenting on certain phrases uttered by the participants (based on pattern matching).

title: Internet bot
sentence: This is sometimes used as a help service for new users, or for censorship of profanity.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Social networking bots are sets of algorithms that take on the duties of repetitive sets of instructions in order to establish a service or connection among social networking users.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Various designs of networking bots vary from chat bots, algorithms designed to converse with a human user, to social bots, algorithms designed to mimic human behaviors to converse with behavioral patterns similar to that of a human user.

title: Internet bot
sentence: The history of social botting can be traced back to Alan Turing in the 1950s and his vision of designing sets of instructional code that passes the Turing test.

title: Internet bot
sentence: From 1964 to 1966, ELIZA, a natural language processing computer program created by Joseph Weizenbaum, is an early indicator of artificial intelligence algorithms that inspired computer programmers to design tasked programs that can match behavior patterns to their sets of instruction.

title: Internet bot
sentence: As a result, natural language processing has become an influencing factor to the development of artificial intelligence and social bots as innovative technological advancements are made alongside the progression of the mass spreading of information and thought on social media websites.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Reports of political interferences in recent elections, including the 2016 US and 2017 UK general elections, have set the notion of botting being more prevalent because of the ethics that is challenged between the bot's design and the bot's designer.

title: Internet bot
sentence: According to Emilio Ferrara, a computer scientist from the University of Southern California reporting on Communications of the ACM, the lack of resources available to implement fact-checking and information verification results in the large volumes of false reports and claims made on these bots in social media platforms.

title: Internet bot
sentence: In the case of Twitter, most of these bots are programmed with searching filter capabilities that target key words and phrases that reflect in favor and against political agendas and retweet them.

title: Internet bot
sentence: While the attention of bots is programmed to spread unverified information throughout the social media platform, it is a challenge that programmers face in the wake of a hostile political climate.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Binary functions are designated to the programs and using an Application Program interface embedded in the social media website executes the functions tasked.

title: Internet bot
sentence: The Bot Effect is what Ferrera reports as when the socialization of bots and human users creates a vulnerability to the leaking of personal information and polarizing influences outside the ethics of the bot's code.

title: Internet bot
sentence: According to Guillory Kramer in his study, he observes the behavior of emotionally volatile users and the impact the bots have on the users, altering the perception of reality.

title: Internet bot
sentence: There has been a great deal of controversy about the use of bots in an automated trading function.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Auction website eBay has been to court in an attempt to suppress a third-party company from using bots to traverse their site looking for bargains; this approach backfired on eBay and attracted the attention of further bots.

title: Internet bot
sentence: The United Kingdom-based bet exchange Betfair saw such a large amount of traffic coming from bots that it launched a WebService API aimed at bot programmers, through which it can actively manage bot interactions.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bot farms are known to be used in online app stores, like the Apple App Store and Google Play, to manipulate positions or to increase positive ratings/reviews.

title: Internet bot
sentence: A rapidly growing, benign, form of internet bot is the chatbot.

title: Internet bot
sentence: From 2016, when Facebook Messenger allowed developers to place chatbots on their platform, there has been an exponential growth of their use on that forum alone.

title: Internet bot
sentence: 30,000 bots were created for Messenger in the first six months, rising to 100,000 by September 2017.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Avi Ben Ezra, CTO of SnatchBot, told Forbes that evidence from the use of their chatbot building platform pointed to a near future saving of millions of hours of human labour as 'live chat' on websites was replaced with bots.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Companies use internet bots to increase online engagement and streamline communication.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Companies often use bots to cut down on cost, instead of employing people to communicate with consumers, companies have developed new ways to be efficient.

title: Internet bot
sentence: These chatbots are used to answer customers' questions.

title: Internet bot
sentence: For example, Domino's has developed a chatbot that can take orders via Facebook Messenger.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Chatbots allow companies to allocate their employees' time to more important things.

title: Internet bot
sentence: A malicious use of bots is the coordination and operation of an automated attack on networked computers, such as a denial-of-service attack by a botnet.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Internet bots can also be used to commit click fraud and more recently have seen usage around MMORPG games as computer game bots.

title: Internet bot
sentence: A spambot is an internet bot that attempts to spam large amounts of content on the Internet, usually adding advertising links.

title: Internet bot
sentence: More than 94.2% of websites have experienced a bot attack.

title: Internet bot
sentence: There are malicious bots (and botnets) of the following types:

title: Internet bot
sentence:
Spambots that harvest email addresses from contact or guestbook pages
Downloader programs that suck bandwidth by downloading entire websites
Website scrapers that grab the content of websites and re-use it without permission on automatically generated doorway pages
Registration bots which sign up a specific email address to a large number of services in order to have the confirmation messages flood the email inbox and distract from important messages indicating a security breach.

title: Internet bot
sentence:
Viruses and worms
DDoS attacks
Botnets, zombie computers, etc.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Spambots that try to redirect people onto a malicious website, sometimes found in comment sections or forums of various websites.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bots are also used to buy up good seats for concerts, particularly by ticket brokers who resell the tickets.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bots are employed against entertainment event-ticketing sites.

title: Internet bot
sentence: The bots are used by ticket brokers to unfairly obtain the best seats for themselves while depriving the general public of also having a chance to obtain the good seats.

title: Internet bot
sentence: The bot runs through the purchase process and obtains better seats by pulling as many seats back as it can.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bots are often used in Massively Multiplayer Online Roleplaying Games to farm for resources that would otherwise take significant time or effort to obtain; this is a concern for most online in-game economies.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bots are also used to increase views for YouTube videos.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bots are used to increase traffic counts on analytics reporting to extract money from advertisers.

title: Internet bot
sentence:
A study by comScore found that 54 percent of display ads shown in thousands of campaigns between May 2012 and February 2013 never appeared in front of a human being.
in 2012, reporter Percy von Lipinski reported that he discovered millions of bot or botted or pinged views at CNN iReport.

title: Internet bot
sentence: CNN iReport quietly removed millions of views from the account of so-called superstar iReporter Chris Morrow.

title: Internet bot
sentence: It is not known if the ad revenue received by CNN from the fake views was ever returned to the advertisers.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Bots may be used on internet forums to automatically post inflammatory or nonsensical posts to disrupt the forum and anger users.

title: Internet bot
sentence: The most widely used anti-bot technique is the use of CAPTCHA, which is a form of Turing test used to distinguish between a human user and a less-sophisticated AI-powered bot, by the use of graphically-encoded human-readable text.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Examples of providers include Recaptcha, and commercial companies such as Minteye, Solve Media, and NuCaptcha.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Captchas, however, are not foolproof in preventing bots as they can often be circumvented by computer character recognition, security holes, and even by outsourcing captcha solving to cheap laborers.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Companies and customers can benefit from internet bots.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Internet bots are allowing customers to communicate with companies without having to communicate with a person.

title: Internet bot
sentence: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines has produced a chatbot that allows customers to receive boarding passes, check in reminders, and other information that is needed for a flight.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Companies have made chatbots that can benefit customers.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Customer engagement has grown since these chatbots have been developed.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Chat bots are used on a daily basis.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Google Assistant and Siri are considered forms of chat bots.

title: Internet bot
sentence: Google Assistant and Siri allow people to ask questions and get a response using an AI system.

title: Internet bot
sentence: These technological advances are positively benefiting people's daily lives.

title: Web brigades
sentence: State sponsored online sockpuppetry and manipulation of online views is practiced by several countries, in particular by Russia, China, United States, United Kingdom, Israel, Turkey, Iran, Vietnam, India and Ukraine.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The earliest documented allegations of the existence of "web brigades" appear to be in the April 2003 Vestnik Online article "The Virtual Eye of Big Brother" by French journalist Anna Polyanskaya (a former assistant to assassinated Russian politician Galina Starovoitova) and two other authors, Andrey Krivov and Ivan Lomako.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The authors claim that up to 1998, contributions to forums on Russian Internet sites (Runet) predominantly reflected liberal and democratic values, but after 2000, the vast majority of contributions reflected totalitarian values.

title: Web brigades
sentence: This sudden change was attributed to the appearance of teams of pro-Russian commenters who appeared to be organized by the Russian state security service.

title: Web brigades
sentence: According to the authors, about 70% of Russian Internet posters were of generally liberal views prior to 1998–1999, while a surge of "antidemocratic" posts (about 60–80%) suddenly occurred at many Russian forums in 2000.

title: Web brigades
sentence: This could also be a reflection to the fact that access to Internet among the general Russian population soared during this time, which was until then accessible only to some sections of the society.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In January 2012, a hacktivist group calling itself the Russian arm of Anonymous published a massive collection of email allegedly belonging to former and present leaders of the pro-Kremlin youth organization Nashi (including a number of government officials).

title: Web brigades
sentence: Journalists who investigated the leaked information found that the pro-Kremlin movement had engaged in a range of activities including paying commentators to post content and hijacking blog ratings in the fall of 2011.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The e-mails indicated that members of the "brigades" were paid 85 rubles (about US$3) or more per comment, depending on whether the comment received replies.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Some were paid as much as 600,000 roubles (about US$21,000) for leaving hundreds of comments on negative press articles on the internet, and were presented with iPads.

title: Web brigades
sentence: A number of high-profile bloggers were also mentioned as being paid for promoting Nashi and government activities.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The Federal Youth Agency, whose head (and the former leader of Nashi)

title: Web brigades
sentence: Vasily Yakemenko was the highest-ranking individual targeted by the leaks, refused to comment on the authenticity of the e-mails.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In 2013, a Freedom House report stated that 22 of 60 countries examined have been using paid pro-government commentators to manipulate online discussions, and that Russia has been at the forefront of this practice for several years, along with China and Bahrain.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In the same year, Russian reporters investigated the St. Petersburg Internet Research Agency, which employs at least 400 people.

title: Web brigades
sentence: They found that the agency covertly hired young people as "Internet operators" paid to write pro-Kremlin postings and comments, smearing opposition leader Alexei Navalny and U.S. politics and culture.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Some Russian opposition journalists state that such practices create a chilling effect on the few independent media outlets remaining in the country.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Further investigations were performed by Russian opposition newspaper Novaya Gazeta and Institute of Modern Russia in 2014–15, inspired by the peak of activity of the pro-Russian brigades during the Ukrainian conflict and assassination of Boris Nemtsov.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The effort of using "troll armies" to promote Putin's policies is reported to be a multimillion-dollar operation.

title: Web brigades
sentence: According to an investigation by the British Guardian newspaper, the flood of pro-Russian comments is part of a coordinated "informational-psychological war operation".

title: Web brigades
sentence: One Twitter bot network was documented to use more than 20,500 fake Twitter accounts to spam negative comments after the death of Boris Nemtsov and events related to the Ukrainian conflict.

title: Web brigades
sentence: An article based on the original Polyanskaya article, authored by the Independent Customers' Association, was published in May 2008 at Expertiza.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Ru.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In this article the term web brigades is replaced by the term Team "G".During his presidency, Donald Trump retweeted a tweet from an account operated by the Russians.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Web brigades commentators sometimes leave hundreds of postings a day that criticize the country's opposition and promote Kremlin-backed policymakers.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Commentators simultaneously react to discussions of "taboo" topics, including the historical role of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, political opposition, dissidents such as Mikhail Khodorkovsky, murdered journalists, and cases of international conflict or rivalry (with countries such as Estonia, Georgia, and Ukraine, but also with the foreign policies of the United States and the European Union).

title: Web brigades
sentence: Prominent journalist and Russia expert Peter Pomerantsev believes Russia's efforts are aimed at confusing the audience, rather than convincing it.

title: Web brigades
sentence: He states that they cannot censor information but can "trash it with conspiracy theories and rumours".To avert suspicions, the users sandwich political remarks between neutral articles on travelling, cooking and pets.

title: Web brigades
sentence: They overwhelm comment sections of media to render meaningful dialogue impossible.

title: Web brigades
sentence: A collection of leaked documents, published by Moy Rayon, suggests that work at the "troll den" is strictly regulated by a set of guidelines.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Any blog post written by an agency employee, according to the leaked files, must contain "no fewer than 700 characters" during day shifts and "no fewer than 1,000 characters" on night shifts.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Use of graphics and keywords in the post's body and headline is also mandatory.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In addition to general guidelines, bloggers are also provided with "technical tasks" – keywords and talking points on specific issues, such as Ukraine, Russia's internal opposition and relations with the West.

title: Web brigades
sentence: On an average working day, the workers are to post on news articles 50 times.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Each blogger is to maintain six Facebook accounts publishing at least three posts a day and discussing the news in groups at least twice a day.

title: Web brigades
sentence: By the end of the first month, they are expected to have won 500 subscribers and get at least five posts on each item a day.

title: Web brigades
sentence: On Twitter, the bloggers are expected to manage 10 accounts with up to 2,000 followers and tweet 50 times a day.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In 2015, Lawrence Alexander disclosed a network of propaganda websites sharing the same Google Analytics identifier and domain registration details, allegedly run by Nikita Podgorny from Internet Research Agency.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The websites were mostly meme repositories focused on attacking Ukraine, Euromaidan, Russian opposition and Western policies.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Other websites from this cluster promoted president Putin and Russian nationalism, and spread alleged news from Syria presenting anti-Western and pro-Bashar al-Assad viewpoints.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In August 2015, Russian researchers correlated Google search statistics of specific phrases with their geographic origin, observing increases in specific politically loaded phrases (such as "Poroshenko", "Maidan", "sanctions") starting from 2013 and originating from very small, peripheral locations in Russia, such as Olgino, which also happens to be the headquarters of the Internet Research Agency company.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The  Internet Research Agency also appears to be the primary sponsor of an anti-Western exhibition Material Evidence.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Since 2015, Finnish reporter Jessikka Aro has inquired into web brigades and Russian trolls.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In addition, Western journalists have referred to the phenomenon and have supported traditional media.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In May 2019, it was reported that a study from the George Washington University found that Russian Twitter bots had tried to inflame the United States' anti-vaccination debate by posting opinions on both sides in 2018.In June 2019 a group of 12 editors introducing coordinated pro-government and anti-opposition bias was blocked on the Russian-language Wikipedia.

title: Web brigades
sentence: In July 2019 two operatives of the Internet Research Agency were detained in Libya and charged with attempting to  influence local elections.

title: Web brigades
sentence: They were reportedly employees of Alexander Malkevich, manager of USA Really, a propaganda website.

title: Web brigades
sentence: The WalkAway campaign is a hashtag introduced by American political activist Brandon Straka in a viral video promoting the idea that members of the Democratic Party should "walk away" from the Party due to its political stances.

title: Web brigades
sentence: This online campaign was swiftly supported by Russian bots.

title: Web brigades
sentence: Jolanta Darczewska: The Anatomy of Russian Information Warfare: The Crimean Operation, a Case Study.

title: Votebots
sentence: The WWW is built on HTTP protocol to transfer information.

title: Votebots
sentence: To imitate legitimate user behavior, such as voting in an online poll, the attacker sends a HTTP request to particular server hosting the poll.

title: Votebots
sentence: Analyzing the target, or the voting project, should be done before actually building the votebot.

title: Votebots
sentence: When handling a voting website for example, one needs to do some webpage analysis on the target, extracting the request URL of the voting action as well as some HTTP header settings to cheat the website.

title: Votebots
sentence: There are lots of tools which help people to analyze the web, such as Firebug and httpanalyzer.

title: Votebots
sentence: One can trace the voting process of HTTP packages by these tools and find the right voting target and some simple protecting tricks used by websites, such as referrer verification.

title: Votebots
sentence: Before sending requests, the attacker must carefully analyze the target and identify potential attack vectors.

title: Votebots
sentence: During analysis, the attacker must determine if HTTP sessions (maintained via cookies) are necessary to consider or not.

title: Votebots
sentence: For example, an online poll could require a session so that only authorized users can vote.

title: Votebots
sentence: Crafting an HTTP request defines how an actual user would behave based on parameters defined in the request.

title: Votebots
sentence: Two HTTP request methods are useful in voting, POST and PUT.

title: Votebots
sentence: Request methods are simply different ways to send data to a certain endpoint (i.e., a poll about "How Many Users Like The Votebots Article?").

title: Votebots
sentence:

>>

title: Votebots
Votebots
sentence: In many voting projects, developers try to distinguish the bots from legal users.

title: Votebots
sentence: They may use the strategy talked about below, and the votebots try to bypass their barriers or detecting methods to successfully vote at the website.

title: Votebots
sentence: For example, some websites restrict the number of votes one IP address can make in a time period.

title: Votebots
sentence: Votebots can bypass this rule by proxy its IP address frequently to cheat the website.

title: Votebots
sentence: Another frequently used strategy is to analyze the account created by a votebot to tell any difference from the normal accounts created by human beings, or to analyze the action history of accounts in the system to find out potential votebots creating ones.

title: Votebots
sentence: Votebots, on the other hand, try to simulate human action such as logging in and out as well as sharing some articles in some social network service before voting.

title: Votebots
sentence: YouTube is reported to be a big victim of votebots.

title: Votebots
sentence: Many small, temporary voting projects are also usual target of votebots.

title: Votebots
sentence: Many people try to program or buy malicious scripts to vote for themselves in some processes, and it is hard to count the number of attacks that happen every day.

title: Votebots
sentence: As talked above, web developers want to distinguish votebot from legal voting users in voting projects.

title: Votebots
sentence: Normal ways includes IP checking, account-handling, Turing test (e.g. CAPTCHA) and account action analysis.

title: Spambot
sentence: E-mail spambots harvest

title: Spambot
sentence: e-mail addresses from material found on the Internet in order to build mailing lists for sending unsolicited e-mail, also known as spam.

title: Spambot
sentence: Such spambots are web crawlers that can gather e-mail addresses from websites, newsgroups, special-interest group (SIG) postings, and chat-room conversations.

title: Spambot
sentence: Because e-mail addresses have a distinctive format, such spambots are easy to code.

title: Spambot
sentence: A number of programs and approaches have been devised to foil spambots.

title: Spambot
sentence: One such technique is address munging, in which an e-mail address is deliberately modified so that a human reader (and/or human-controlled web browser) can interpret it

title: Spambot
sentence: but spambots cannot.

title: Spambot
sentence: This has led to the evolution of more sophisticated spambots that are able to recover e-mail addresses from character strings that appear to be munged, or instead can render the text into a web browser and then scrape it for e-mail addresses.

title: Spambot
sentence: Alternative transparent techniques include displaying all or part of the e-mail address on a web page as an image, a text logo shrunken to normal size using inline CSS, or as text with the order of characters jumbled, placed into readable order at display time using CSS.

title: Spambot
sentence: Forum spambots browse the internet, looking for guestbooks, wikis, blogs, forums, and other types of web forms that they can then use to submit bogus content.

title: Spambot
sentence: These often use OCR technology to bypass CAPTCHAs.

title: Spambot
sentence: Some spam messages are targeted towards readers and can involve techniques of target marketing or even phishing, making it hard to tell real posts from the bot generated ones.

title: Spambot
sentence: Other spam messages are not meant to be read by humans, but are instead posted to increase the number of links to a particular website, to boost its search engine ranking.

title: Spambot
sentence: One way to prevent spambots from creating automated posts is to require the poster to confirm their intention to post via e-mail.

title: Spambot
sentence: Since most spambot scripts use a fake e-mail address when posting, any email confirmation request is unlikely to be successfully routed to them.

title: Spambot
sentence: Some spambots will pass this step by providing a valid email address and use it for validation, mostly via webmail services.

title: Spambot
sentence: Using methods such as security questions are also proven to be effective in curbing posts generated by spambots, as they are usually unable to answer it upon registering.

title: Spambot
sentence: A Twitterbot is a program used to produce automated posts on the Twitter microblogging service, or to automatically follow Twitter users.

title: Spambot
sentence: Twitterbots come in various forms.

title: Spambot
sentence: For example, many serve as spam, enticing clicks on promotional links.

title: Spambot
sentence: Others post @replies or automatically "retweet" in response to tweets that include a certain word or phrase.

title: Spambot
sentence: These automatic tweets are often seen as fun or silly.

title: Spambot
sentence: Some Twitter users even program Twitterbots to assist themselves with scheduling or reminders.
